Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Enthusiastic \En*thu`si*as"tic\, Enthusiastical \En*thu`si*as"tic*al\, a. [Gr. ? .] Filled with enthusiasm; characterized by enthusiasm; zealous; as, an enthusiastic lover of art. ``Enthusiastical raptures.'' --Calamy. -- {En*thu`si*as"tic*al*ly}, adv. [1913 Webster]
A young man . . . of a visionary and enthusiastic character. --W. Irving. [1913 Webster]

enthusiastically adv 1: with enthusiasm; in an enthusiastic manner; "they discussed the question enthusiastically" [ant: {unenthusiastically}] 2: in a lavish or enthusiastic manner; "he extolled her virtues sky-high" [syn: {sky-high}]
